Posts.Content: I'm new here found this site just tying to find out more about PC. My psa wend from 3.5 in 2017 to 1 yr later 9.47. My father has PC. My GP referred me to a urologist who did a DRE. He said I had a ridge and firm area on my left side and said I needed a biopsy. They did 12 cores 6 were positive. LB GS 3+3=6 grade group 1 involving <5% perineural invasion identified LLB GS 4+3=7 grade group 3 70% gleason pattern 4 involving 50% perineural invasion identified LM GS 4+3=7 grade group 3 70% gleason pattern 4 involving 40% LLM GS 4+3=7 grade group 3 90% gleason pattern 4 involving 65% LM GS 3+4=7 grade group 2 involving 5% RLA GS 3+3=6 grade group 1 involving 10% I don't see my DR till later next week I got my results of the online patient portal it says clinical stage T2b R97.20 and N40.2 whats this mean? Im only 48
Posts.Title: All alone with no support

Posts.Content: Thank you its a lot to take in. But how do I know its only in the prostate? They said stage T2b but that was just from the core samples I haven't had any other tests yet.
Posts.Title: All alone with no support
